page.title: 18SHELFORD-BUILDING-FARMING
page.content: Shelford Manor and surrounding lands, owned by the Crown,but leased to the Chatterton family for the last 45yrs., is the only other historical building of note in Shelford. Once a priory and later the last Royalist stronghold to be burnt down in the Civil War,the manor was restored from the original stone in 1670.There are 22 rooms in the house, although 6 on the top floor are no longer used. The present occupants,father,mother and two children,have lived in the manor for 5yrs. They farm 450 acres and keep a dairy herd,as well as growing corn,potatoes and sugarbeet. They keep horses for pleasure,not as a business proposition.The Chattertons enjoy 3 day eventing and hunting with the Belvoir hunt.
